title: Missing Number
description: Given an array nums containing n distinct numbers in the range [0, n], return the only number in the range that is missing from the array.

examples.explanation: n = 3 since there are 3 numbers, so all numbers are in the range [0,3]. 2 is the missing number in the range since it does not appear in nums.
n = 2 since there are 2 numbers, so all numbers are in the range [0,2]. 2 is the missing number in the range since it does not appear in nums.

constraints: All the numbers of nums are unique.

brute-force.name: Brute Force
brute-force.description: Compare sum of range with sum of array.

steps.instruction: Define the function missing_number that takes nums.
steps.hint: Use the `def` keyword to define the function.
Get length `n`. Use the formula `n * (n + 1) // 2` to find the sum of numbers from 0 to n.
Subtract the sum of the array from the expected sum to find the missing number.

optimal.name: Optimal
optimal.description: XOR index and value. Missing number remains.

steps.instruction: Define the function missing_number that takes nums.
steps.hint: Use the `def` keyword to define the function.
Initialize `res` with `len(nums)`. Iterate through `nums` and XOR `res` with both the index `i` and the value `nums[i]`.
